articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian prosecutors said they were investigating attacks on civilians in two cities in the northeastern region of Kharkiv and President Volodymyr Zelenskiy reported successes by troops fighting a fresh Russian assault there on Saturday.
articles.title: Ukraine investigates civilian injuries, battles rage in Kharkiv region

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Resurgent Russian forces, which outnumber and outgun the Ukrainians, have mounted multiple attacks on the eastern front.
articles.title: Ukraine struggles to hold eastern front as Russians advance on cities

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Fighters attacked Israeli forces in Jabalia and Rafah with anti-tank rockets, mortar bombs, and explosive devices.
articles.title: Dozens killed and wounded as Israeli forces thrust deeper in Gaza's Jabalia and Rafah

articles.author: Rami Amichay, Michal Yaakov Itzhaki
articles.description: German-Israeli Shani Louk's father says that finally laying his daughter to rest will be a gift after her body was recovered from Gaza, months after she was killed in Hamas' Oct. 7 attack on southern Israel.
articles.title: Shani Louk's parents thankful to have a grave after her body was returned from Gaza

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: Several top White House aides say they are confident protests across U.S. college campuses against Israel's offensive in Gaza will not translate into significantly fewer votes for Joe Biden in November's election, despite polls showing many Democrats are deeply unhappy about the U.S. president's policy on the war.
articles.title: Despite polls, Biden aides insist Gaza campus protests will not hurt reelection bid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The condition of Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico has stabilised but remains serious, the country's health minister said on Saturday, following Wednesday's assassination attempt against the central European leader.
articles.title: Slovak Prime Minister Fico stable but in serious condition

articles.author: Tom Sims
articles.description: German police arrested eight climate activists who breached the grounds of Munich airport on Saturday, briefly causing the airport to close and leading to around 60 flight cancellations during a busy holiday weekend.
articles.title: Eight arrested after climate activists breach German airport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Unrest in France's Pacific island territory has caused the deaths of at least six people.
articles.title: Australians stranded in New Caledonia 'running out of food' amid civil unrest

articles.author: Anait Miridzhanian, Sfundo Parakozov
articles.description: South Africa's new uMkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party is aiming to win a parliamentary majority in a May 29 election so that it can implement reforms without resistance from opponents, former President Jacob Zuma said on Saturday.
articles.title: South Africa's new MK party seeks majority win in pivotal election, Zuma says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran on Saturday said it will send experts to its ally Venezuela to help with medical accelerators in hospitals it said had been stopped due to Western sanctions.
articles.title: Iran to send experts to ally Venezuela to help with medical accelerators
